get.description:
Returns a list of Attendance Codes used throughout Time & Attendance. 

These are used to track absences in Avanti.
Returns a list of banks and their financial institution numbers. The format of Text in the response depends on the company web setting Lookup.Banks.

Returns a list of Benefit Groups used in Benefits Administration. The format of Text in the response depends on the company web setting Lookup.BenefitGroups.

In Avanti, Benefit Groups are the different groupings of employee benefit coverage and the applicable benefit codes for each group.

post.description:
Returns a list of the codes used throughout Avanti. The Code Setup endpoint can provide the name for the available codes. 

The sorting and filters shouldn't be sent unless they are being used.

get.description:
Returns the setup for the codes used throughout Avanti. 

There are several types of codes: 
- Payroll (PY)
- Hub (AT)
- People Management (HR)
- Workflow Management (PM)
- Talent Acquisition (TR)

parameters.name: module
parameters.description: Returns the setup for this type of code. Use PY for payroll. Use AT for Hub. Use HR for People Management. Use PM for Workflow Management. Use TR for Talent Acquisition.

get.description:
Returns a list of the Employment Default Groups. The format of Text in the response depends on the company web setting Lookup.DefaultGroups.

In Avanti, these Default Groups can help quickly setup new employees based on common setup requirements. Default Groups can be set up to add earning and deduction/benefit codes, position, employee values, vacation groups, unions, and more. If a setup change is required, Default Groups can quickly update all employees within a group.

put.description: Update an existing dependent for an employee.

post.description:
Creates a new dependent for an employee. 

Dependents can be added to employee benefits. Additionally, they can be used to indicate beneficiaries.

parameters.name: empNo
parameters.description: The employee number of the employee assigned to the user. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', this must be blank or 000001005.

parameters.name: dependentNo
parameters.description: The number for the dependent. Each dependent for an employee will have a unique dependent number.

parameters.name: empNo
parameters.description: The employee number of the employee assigned to the user. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', this must be blank or 000001005.

parameters.name: empNo
parameters.description: The employee number of the employee assigned to the user. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', this must be blank or 000001005.

get.description:
Returns a list of the employee's emergency contacts. 

Emergency contacts indicate who should be contacted in case of an emergency, as well as the details to contact them.

parameters.name: empNo
parameters.description: The employee number of the employee assigned to the user. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', this must be blank or 000001005.

put.description:
Update an existing emergency contact for an employee. 

Emergency contacts indicate who should be contacted in case of an emergency, as well as the details to contact them.

post.description:
Creates a new emergency contact for an employee. 

Emergency contacts indicate who should be contacted in case of an emergency, as well as the details to contact them.

parameters.name: empNo
parameters.description: The employee number of the employee assigned to the user. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', this must be blank or 000001005.

get.description: Returns the emergency contacts setup data.

parameters.name: empNo
parameters.description: The employee number of the employee assigned to the user. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', this must be blank or 000001005.

put.description: Updates the home address of an employee.
Update the basic information for the employee, such as full name, birth date, language and SIN information.

parameters.name: deductCode
parameters.description: A three-digit ID for the deduction code greater than 499.

parameters.name: V34
parameters.description: The employee's V34 amount.

parameters.name: V35
parameters.description: The employee's V35 amount.

parameters.name: empNo
parameters.description: The employee number of the employee whose V34/V35 value is being updated.

put.description: Updates the V34 and V35 values on the employee's Deduction/Benefit Code. These values may calculate the employee's deduction or benefit amount, depending on the code setup.

parameters.name: empNo
parameters.description: The employee number of the employee assigned to the user. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', this must be blank or 000001005.

parameters.name: empNo
parameters.description: The employee number of the employee assigned to the user. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', this must be blank or 000001005.

parameters.description: The employee number of the employee assigned to the user. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', this must be blank or 000001005.

parameters.name: empNo
parameters.description: The employee number of the employee assigned to the user. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', this must be blank or 000001005.

parameters.name: empNo
parameters.description: The employee number of the employee assigned to the user. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', this must be blank or 000001005.

parameters.name: empNo
parameters.description: The employee number of the employee assigned to the user. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', this must be blank or 000001005.

parameters.name: empNo
parameters.description: The employee number of the employee assigned to the user. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', this must be blank or 000001005.

parameters.name: empNo
parameters.description: The employee number of the employee assigned to the user. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', this must be blank or 000001005.

parameters.name: empNo
parameters.description: The employee number of the employee. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', you can use employee number 000001005.

get.description:
Returns a list of the employee's primary and secondary positions. The format of Text in the response depends on the company web setting Lookup.Positions.

A position will only be included if it is active on the Employee Profile, with an effective date in the past and a expiry date in the future, if these are entered on the employee.

parameters.name: empNo
parameters.description: The employee number of the employee. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', you can use employee number 000001005.

parameters.name: empNo
parameters.description: The employee number of the employee. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', you can use employee number 000001005.

parameters.name: empNo
parameters.description: The employee number of the employee assigned to the user. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', this must be blank or 000001005.

get.description:
Returns a list of the defined Employment Status codes. The format of Text in the response depends on the company web setting Lookup.EmploymentStatus.

In Avanti, these are used to manage and classify employees. For example, an employment status code may be used to indicate that an employee is on leave.

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: The number of entries returned.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of entries to skip.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Only pay statements that match the number entered will be returned. Pay Statements will match based on the values in the following fields:  PayEndingDate, ChequeNo, ChequeDate, Earnings, Deductions, Benefits, NetPay

get.description:
Returns a list of GL Groups. The format of Text in the response depends on the company web setting Lookup.GlEarnGroups.

In Avanti, GL Groups provide the ability to expense earning amounts to multiple G/L accounts.

Returns a list of the Rate Grid Codes. The format of Text in the response depends on the company web setting Lookup.GridCodes.

Rate Grids are defined rate structures that can be applied to employees based on position or earnings, such a shift premiums and travel rates. Additionally, future rates can be defined for each rate grid.

Returns a list of Job Status. The format of Text in the response depends on the company web setting Lookup.JobStatus.

These are used to classify employees on their job status, such as Casual vs Contract workers.

Returns a list of the location codes. The format of Text in the response depends on the company web setting Lookup.Location.

Location codes are used throughout Avanti to identify employee locations, departments, zones, units, etc.

post.summary: Add New Terms of Service Contract

get.summary: Get Default Group Values and Setup

get.description: Returns the details of the notification for the employee attached to the Avanti User.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the notification you would like to get the data for.

get.description:
Returns a list of notifications for the employee attached to the Avanti User. 

If no request parameters are sent, the 20 most recent notifications are returned.

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: The IDs of the notification types you would like to get the data for. If blank, notifications for all types are returned.

parameters.name: notificationId
parameters.description:
Used with the newer parameter to determine which notifications to return. 
Returns the notifications newer or older than the notificationId. 

If blank, the most recent notifications are returned.

parameters.name: newer
parameters.description:
Used with the notificationId parameter to determine which notifications to return. 
If True or blank, notifications more recent than the notificationId are returned. 
If false, notifications older than the notificationId are returned.

parameters.name: unreadOnly
parameters.description: If true, only unread notifications are returned. If false, all notifications are returned. Default is false.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Only notifications that contain this text in the subject or content are returned.

parameters.name: lastLoaded
parameters.description:
Returns a list of notifications with a changed read status after this date. The date in ISO 8601 format.
These notifications are returned in read and unread. This can be used address caching when users access notifications across different devices.

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: The number of entries returned.

get.description:
This returns a list of all the notification types and their setup. 

The setup includes whether: 
- This type of notification is used.  
- Employees will receive these notifications by default. 
- Employees can disable these notifications.

put.description: Update whether the employee is receiving notifications for the notification type. The employee is always the employee attached to the user.

get.description:
Returns a list of the pay codes. The format of Text in the response depends on the company web setting Lookup.PayCode.

In Avanti, pay codes are used throughout Time and Attendance to determine the earning code for the time, whether the entry is from/to times or units/units of measure. and whether punches are used for the time.

Returns a list of pay groups. The format of Text in the response depends on the company web setting Lookup.PayGroups.

In Avanti, pay groups determine many of the pay and tax calculations factors, such as EI rates, CPP rates, the CRA business number, Quebec Employer ID, etc. They are assigned to employees that are paid at the same time and share the same pay period factors.
Returns a list of pay statements, with the pay totals,  for the employee assigned to the user.

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: The number of entries returned.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of entries to skip.

parameters.name: empNo
parameters.description: The employee number of the employee assigned to the user. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', this must be blank or 000001005.

parameters.name: run
parameters.description: Run numbers greater than the run number specified will be returned. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', the lowest run number is 1998 for the employee.

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description:
Determines the order of the statements returned, in conjunction with sortDesc. 
Enter what determines the order from the following options: PayEndingDate, ChequeNo, ChequeDate, Earnings, Deductions, Benefits, NetPay

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Only pay statements that match the number entered will be returned. Pay Statements will match based on the values in the following fields:  PayEndingDate, ChequeNo, ChequeDate, Earnings, Deductions, Benefits, NetPay

parameters.name: sortDesc
parameters.description: When true, statements will be in descending order based on the sortOrder. When false, statements will be in ascending order. Default is true.

parameters.name: empNo
parameters.description: The employee number of the employee. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', you can use employee number 000001005.

get.description: Returns a byte array of the pay statement with a content type of application/pdf for the employee assigned to the current Avanti User.

parameters.name: runNumber
parameters.description: The pay statement PDF will be returned for this run number. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', the run numbers are 1998, 2000, 2002, 2003 for this employee.

parameters.name: empNo
parameters.description: The employee number of the employee assigned to the user. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', this must be blank or 000001005.

parameters.name: runNumber
parameters.description: The pay statement PDF will be returned for this run number. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', the run numbers are 1998, 2000, 2002, 2003 for this employee.

parameters.name: empNo
parameters.description: The employee number of the employee assigned to the user. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', this must be blank or 000001005.

put.description:
Provides the ability to update the personal information for the employee.

Best practice to do a Get Personal Info, update the required values, then do a Post Personal Info.

get.description:
Returns a list of the Figures, Dates, and Text Fields for the employee. Figures are defined on the Profile Field Names tab of the Payroll Parameters. 

The Figures and Text Fields for the employee are on the Values tab of the Employee Profile. The Dates for the employee are on the Dates tab of the Employee Profile.

parameters.name: empNo
parameters.description: The employee number of the employee assigned to the user. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', this must be blank or 000001005.

parameters.name: empNo
parameters.description: The employee number of the employee. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', you can use employee number 000001005.

parameters.name: empNo
parameters.description: The employee number of the employee. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', you can use employee number 000001005.

parameters.name: empNo
parameters.description: The employee number of the employee. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', you can use employee number 000001005.

parameters.name: includeInactive
parameters.description: Determines whether all positions will be returned. If true, active and inactive employees will be included in the response. If false, only active employees will be included in the response.  Default is false.

parameters.name: masculine
parameters.description: Determines which French position description is returned. If true, the masculine description will be returned. If false, the feminine description will be returned.  By default, this is false.  A French description will only be included when a French access token is provided.

get.description: Returns a list of all the position codes. The format of Text in the response depends on the company web setting Lookup.Positions.

post.description:
This will return the contents of the specified report based on the options selected. 

Using this endpoint, additional report options can be included in the request body to ensure only the information you require is included in the results. If you are only filtering the report result by a date range and employee range, please use the Get Report Data endpoint.   

You can try the Reporter endpoint by using the ID  WageSample in 'Send a Test Request'. 

Want additional information on setting up a report? Go to https://apidocs.avanti.dev/custom-endpoints to learn more.

get.description:
This will return the contents of the specified report based.

Using this endpoint, the information returned can be filtered based on  date range and employee range. If you need the report to filtered by additional options, please use the Get Report Data With Options endpoint.  

You can try the Reporter endpoint by using the ID  WageSample in 'Send a Test Request'. 

Want additional information on setting up a report? Go to https://apidocs.avanti.dev/custom-endpoints to learn more.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the notification you would like to get the data for.

parameters.name: fromEmpNo
parameters.description: The first employee number in the range of employees employees used to filter the data.This is required if toEmpNo is defined. If blank, returns data for all employees.

parameters.name: toEmpNo
parameters.description: The last employee in the range of employees used to filter the data. This is required if fromEmpNo is defined. If blank, returns data for all employees.

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: The first date in the range of dates used to filter the data.This is required if toDate is defined. If blank, returns data for all dates.

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: The last date in the range of dates used to filter the data. This is required if fromDate is defined. If blank, returns data for all dates.

parameters.name: merge
parameters.description: If true, the options set on the report definition will be used. If false, the options on the report definition will be ignored.

get.description:
Returns a list of the schedule templates. The format of Text in the response depends on the company web setting Lookup.ScheduleTemplates. 

In Avanti, Schedule templates define the commonly used schedule rotations. These rotations can be used to create employee schedules automatically by rolling schedules forward or on demand by adding the schedule template for a specific day.

This returns a list of the menus that contain the text from the request in the:
- Menu Description
-  Menu URL
- Program name

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Only menu that contain this text in the description, URL or program name are returned.

get.description:
Returns a list of the shift codes. 

In Avanti, shift codes are used in Schedules and Time Cards to apply default from/to times, break rules and premium rules.

Returns a list of the defined tasks.

In Avanti, Task Ids are used throughout time entry. These are for tracking purposes and are defined to suit your organizations needs.

post.description:
Create time data entries for your employees. 

This can be used when you have time data information prepared by other systems that you wish to incorporate into Time and Attendance module in Avanti.

If some time data entries don't pass validation, a message is returned and the entries won't be imported. All valid entries are created.

parameters.name: empNo
parameters.description: The employee number of the employee. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', you can use employee number 000001005.

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: The number of entries returned.

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: The number of entries returned.

parameters.name: empNo
parameters.description: The employee number of the employee assigned to the user. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', this must be blank or 000001005.

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: The number of entries returned.

parameters.name: empNo
parameters.description: The employee number of the employee assigned to the user. When testing using 'Send a Test Request', this must be blank or 000001005.

get.description:
Returns a list of the Union Codes defined. The format of Text in the response depends on the company web setting Lookup.Unions. 

In Avanti, Union Codes identify the union affiliations and are used to determine union dues.

Returns a list of the earning codes setup for paying vacation each period or to pay out accrued. The format of Text in the response depends on the company web setting Lookup.VacationEarningCodes. 

In Avanti, vacation earning codes must have either Vacation or Other Vacation selected for the Earning Type.

Returns a list of the defined vacation group. The format of Text in the response depends on the company web setting Lookup.VacationGroups. 

In Avanti, vacation groups determine the vacation entitlement calculation for each employee assigned to the group.

Returns a list of the vacation options. The Text will always be the description of the option.

In Avanti, the Vacation Option indicates what will happen with the calculated vacation for an employee.

Returns a list of the Workers Compensation Groups. 

In Avanti, these maintain all WCB rates and maximums for payroll processing.
Returns the most recent punch of the employee attached to the user.

post.description:
Creates a punch for the employee. 

The time of the punch is the current time on the SQL Server, adjusted by the time zone specified on Web Punch Employee Setup on the Desktop Application. If there is no setup for the employee, the time will be adjusted by the Province of Employment on the Tax Factors tab of the Employee Profile.

Employees cannot punch if ‘Allow Web Punch’ is not selected on Time Clock >> Installation & Maintenance >> Employee Web & PC Punch Setup. 

If company web setting MobileSettings.WebPunchSettings.RequireLocationServices is true, longitude and latitude must be included.

get.description:
Returns true if the employee can punch and false if the employee cannot. 

Employees cannot punch if ‘Allow Web Punch’ is not selected on Time Clock >> Installation & Maintenance >> Employee Web & PC Punch Setup.

Returns a list of the defined employee work groups. The format of Text in the response depends on the company web setting Lookup.WorkGroups.

In Avanti, Work Groups are used to determine which employees enter time using Time and Attendance. These group employees based on common rules and shift(s). Each Work Group has a Holiday Rule, Punch Rule and Overtime Rule and one or more Shifts.

username.description: The Avanti User Name that the employee uses to log into ASSP, Avanti Go, and the Avanti Desktop Application, if applicable. Must be a valid Avanti User Name.

empNo.description: The employee number of the employee. When not provided the employee number assigned to the current user will be used if available.

earningCode.description: The three-digit earning code for the entry. Earning Codes are from 001 to 499.

taskId.description:
The ID of the task for the time worked. 

For a list of tasks set up in the company, use the 'Get TaskIds' endpoint.

rate.description:
The dollar rate of pay for the time worked. This will be used with the units to determine the gross earnings for the time worked.

If blank, the rate of pay will be determined within Avanti.

empNo.description: The employee number assigned to the employee.

earningDate.description: The date the employee worked in ISO 8601 format.

earningCode.description: The three-digit earning code for the entry. Earning Codes are from 001 to 499.

positionCode.description:
The ID of the position worked. If the position is left blank, the employees primary position will be used if required for rates. 

If ‘Only allow defined Employee Positions in time data entry’ is selected on the Time Data Entry tab of Payroll Parameters, the position must be on the employee’s profile.

attendanceCode.description:
The attendance code for the worked time. 

Must be a valid attendance code. 'Get Attendance Codes' will return the valid codes.

shiftIdCode.description:
The ID of the shift worked. If left blank, premium rules and break rules will not apply to the time worked.

Must be a valid shift ID. 'Get Shift Codes' will return a list of all the valid shifts.

wcbOverrideCode.description:
The ID of the WCB Group. If left blank, the time will apply to the WCB group selected on the employee's profile.

Must be a valid WCB group. 'List WCB Groups' will return a list of all the valid groups.

vacationOverrideCode.description:
The ID of the vacation group. If left blank, the time will apply to the vacation group selected on the employee's profile.

Must be a valid vacation group. 'List Vacation Groups' will return a list of all the valid groups.

unionOverrideCode.description:
The ID of the union code. If left blank, the time will apply to the union selected on the employee's profile.

Must be a valid union code. 'List Union Codes' will return a list of all the valid codes.

taskId.description:
The ID of the task for the time worked. 

For a list of tasks set up in the company, use the 'Get TaskIds' endpoint.

rate.description:
The dollar rate of pay for the time worked. This will be used with the units to determine the gross earnings for the time worked.

If blank, the rate of pay will be determined within Avanti.

recordSourceId.description:
A unique identifier for the time which prevents duplicate time from being accidently created in Avanti. If a duplicate recordSourceID is found within Avanti or in API body, the time will not import. 

For example, this could be the identifier from the time capturing system.

glAccount.description:
The GL account for the worked time. This is required when parameter glType is 'a'.

Must be a valid account. 'List GL Accounts' will return the valid accounts for each segment. A combination of segments can be used to create the valid account.

glGroup.description:
The GL group for the worked time. This is required when parameter glType is 'g'.

Must be a valid GL group. 'List GL Groups' will return the valid GL Groups.

comments.description: Enter comments for the worked time. Comments can be up to 1024 characters.

text.description: The number of the Figures Field, from 1 to 15, in the order they appear on the Employee Profile. For example, M34 is 14.

value.description: A number between -999,999,999.99 and 999,999,999.99. Can be up to two decimal places.

empNo.description: The employee number of the employee for this dependent.

code.description: The Deduction/Benefit codes which cover this dependent. This parameter cannot be used in an post or put at this time.

dependentNo.description: The number for the dependent. Each dependent for an employee will have a unique dependent number.

givenName.description: The first name of the employee's dependent.

surname.description: The last name of the employee's dependent.

initial.description: The middle initial of the employee's dependent.

relationship.description:
Indicates whether the dependent's relationship to the employee. 
   1 = Spouse
   2 = Child 
   3 = Common Law Spouse
   4 = Beneficiary
   5 = Other

birthDate.description: The date of the dependent's birth in ISO 8601 format.

gender.description:
Indicates whether the dependent's gender is female, male, or undefined. 
F is female.
M is male.
X is undefined.

useEmployeeAddress.description: Indicates whether the dependent lives with the employee. If true, the dependent's home address and phone number will default to the employee's address and phone number. Default is false.

address1.description: The first line of the dependent's home address. This will only be used if the parameter UseEmployeeAddress is false.

address2.description: The second line of the dependent's home address. This will only be used if the parameter UseEmployeeAddress is false.

city.description: The city for the dependent's home address. This will only be used if the parameter UseEmployeeAddress is false.

province.description:
The two character abbreviation of the province or state for the dependent's home address. If the employee resides outside of Canada and the United States, province should be ZZ.
This will only be used if the parameter UseEmployeeAddress is false.

country.description:
The three-character abbreviation of the country where the dependent resides. If the province is a Canadian province or territory, the country should CAN. If the province is an American state, the country should be USA.
This will only be used if the parameter UseEmployeeAddress is false.

postal.description: The postal code of the employee's home address.

homePhone.description: The phone number for the dependent's home. This will only be used if the parameter UseEmployeeAddress is false.

smoker.description:
Whether the dependent is a smoker. Default is False. This may be used for benefit calculations.
    True for smoker
    False for nonsmoker

overage.description:
Indicates whether the dependent is over the age of majority. Default is 0. 
   0 = NA/under the age of majority
   1 = Student
   2 = Disabled
   3 = Disabled Student

cohabitationDate.description: The initial date that the dependent started living with the employee in ISO 8601 format.

trusteeRequired.description:
Whether the dependent requires a trustee. Defaults to false. 

If true, a trustee must be entered on the beneficiaries tab of Employee Benefits in the Avanti desktop application.

isEmployee.description: Whether the dependent is also an employee. Default is False. If True, dependentEmpNo must be specified.

dependentEmpNo.description: The dependents employee number, if the dependent is also an employee. This will only be used if the parameter isEmployee is true.

empNo.description: The employee number of the employee that this emergency contact belongs to.

givenName.description: The first name of the employee's emergency contact.

surname.description: The last name of the employee's emergency contact.

initial.description: The middle initial of the employee's emergency contact.

useEmployeeAddress.description: Indicates whether the emergency contact lives with the employee. If true, the emergency contact's home address and phone number will default to the employee's address and phone number. Default is false.

address1.description: The first line of the emergency contact's home address. This will only be used if the parameter UseEmployeeAddress is false.

address2.description: The second line of the emergency contact's home address. This will only be used if the parameter UseEmployeeAddress is false.

city.description: The city for the emergency contact's home address. This will only be used if the parameter UseEmployeeAddress is false.

province.description:
The two character abbreviation of the province or state for the emergency contact's home address. If the employee resides outside of Canada and the United States, province should be ZZ.
This will only be used if the parameter UseEmployeeAddress is false.

country.description: The three-character abbreviation of the country where the employee resides. If the province is a Canadian province or territory, the country should CAN. If the province is an American state, the country should be USA.

postal.description: The postal code of the emergency contact's home address. This will only be used if the parameter UseEmployeeAddress is false.

homePhone.description: The phone number for the emergency contact's home. This will only be used if the parameter UseEmployeeAddress is false.

workPhone.description: The phone number for the emergency contact's work.

comments.description: Additional information about the emergency contact. Can be up to 1024 characters.

relationship.description: The employee's relationship to the emergency contact. Must be a valid relationship code. 'Get Emergency Setup' will return the valid relationship codes.

photoRevision.description: Used to prevent photo caching. When the photo is updated or the existing photo is deleted, enter a unique value here to ensure that the changes are applied immediately.

userName.description: The Avanti User Name that the employee uses to log into ASSP, Avanti Go, and the Avanti Desktop Application, if applicable. Must be a valid Avanti User Name.

initial.description: The middle initial of the employee's name.

preferredName.description: The name the employee prefers be called instead of their given name.

address1.description: The first line of the employee's home address.

address2.description: The second line of the employee's home address.

city.description: The city for the employee's home address.

province.description: The two character abbreviation of the province or state for the employee's home address. If the employee resides outside of Canada and the United States, province should be ZZ.

country.description: The three-character abbreviation of the country where the employee resides. If the province is a Canadian province or territory, the country should CAN. If the province is an American state, the country should be USA.

postal.description: The postal code of the employee's home address.

birthDate.description: The date of the employee's birth in ISO 8601 format. This is used to determine the employees Canadian Pension Plan (CPP) eligibility.

seniorityDate.description: The date used to determine the employee's seniority in ISO 8601 format.

firstLanguage.description:
Indicates whether the employee would like their correspondence, such as pay statements, in French or English. 
F is French.
E is English.

gender.description:
Indicates whether the gender is female, male, or undefined. 
F is female.
M is male.
X is undefined.

marital.description:
The marital status of the employee.
        M = Married
	S = Single
	D = CommonLaw
	E = Divorced
	F = Separated
	G = Widowed
	Any other character  = other

sin.description: The employee's Social Insurance Number. If this is not available, nine zeros will be accepted. If the SIN starts with a 9, a sinExpiryDate should be specified.

previousSurname.description: The employee's previous surname, if applicable.

sinExpiryDate.description: The date the employee's temporary Social Insurance Number (SIN) will expire. If the employee's SIN begins with a 9, this should be specified. The SIN expiry is in ISO 8601 format.

email.description:
The employee's primary email. Emails sent by Avanti will be sent to this email address when the specific email address is not provided. This is required on Post. 

For example, if the employee does not have a Pay Statement email address defined, the pay statement will be emailed to the primary email.

The email type of the email1. 
        0 = Primary
        1 = Pay Statement
        2 = Alert
        3 = Home
        4 = Work
        5 = Tax Slips

otherDate1.description: The date for Profile Field M11. The date in ISO 8601 format.

otherDate2.description: The date for Profile Field M12. The date in ISO 8601 format.

otherDate3.description: The date for Profile Field M13. The date in ISO 8601 format.

otherDate4.description: The date for Profile Field M14. The date in ISO 8601 format.

initialHireDate.description: The date the employee first started with the company in ISO 8601 format.

vacDate.description: The vacation date in ISO 8601 format. This determines the vacation service months for vacation calculation purposes.

empNo.description: The employee number of the employee. When not provided the employee number assigned to the current user will be used if available.

position.description: The position ID of the employee's primary position.

positionName.description: The English description of the employee's primary position. This will not be updated on Post.

positionNameFr.description: The French description of the employee's primary position. This will not be updated on Post.

active.description:
Whether the employee is active or inactive. 
     True = Active
     False = Inactive
Employees that are not active are omitted from payroll processing, even if they have time data entered for them

webStatements.description:
Determines whether the employee can see their pay statements on the web. 
    True = Web Statements enabled
     False = Web Statements are not enabled

payGroup.description: The ID of the employee's pay group.

location.description: The ID of the employee's location.

provinceEmployed.description:
The ID of the employee's province of employment. This will set the proper tax factors for the employee. 
   AB = Alberta
   BC = British Columbia
   MB = Manitoba
   NB = New Brunswick
   NL = Newfoundland
   NS = Nova Scotia
   NT = Northwest Territories
   NU = Nunavut
   ON = Ontario
   PE = Prince Edward Is.
   QC = Quebec
   SK = Saskatchewan
   YT = Yukon Territories
   ZZ = Outside North America

fte.description:
The employee's FTE (full time equivalent), where 1 is full time, 0.5 is half, etc. This value ranges from 0 to 9.99. 
This may be used to adjust the amount paid to a salaried employee.

wcbGroup.description: The ID of the employee's WCB group (Worker's Compensation Group).

vacGroup.description: The ID of the employee's vacation group.

vacCode.description:
The employee's vacation option. 
    0 = Not Accrued Or Paid
    1 = Paid Each Period
    2 = Accrued
    3 = Pay Out Accrued

vacEarnCode.description: The earning code that the vacation is paid out on. Should be included if vacCode is 1 or 3.

glType.description:
The employee's G/L option. 
     a = G/L Account
     g = G/L Group

glGroup.description: The ID of employee's G/L Group. Should be included if glType is g.

earnGl.description: This property is not used at this time.

workGroup.description: The ID of the employee's work group.

jobStatus.description: The ID of the employee's job status.

smoker.description:
Whether the employee is a smoker. This may be used for benefit calculations
    True for smoker
    False for nonsmoker

lastHireDate.description: The date the employee was most recently hired by the company in ISO 8601 format.

prevVacEarn.description: The value for accumulator A1, Vacation Dollars, from the previous pay period. This is used in formulas that include the variable P1.

prevWcbEarn.description: The value for accumulator A2, WCB Dollars, from the previous pay period. This is used in formulas that include the variable P2.

prevMiscEarnAccum1.description: The value for accumulator A3 from the previous pay period. This is used in formulas that include the variable P3.

prevMiscEarnAccum2.description: The value for accumulator A4 from the previous pay period. This is used in formulas that include the variable P4.

prevVacHrs.description: The value for accumulator A11, Vacation Hours, from the previous pay period. This is used in formulas that include the variable P11.

prevWcbHrs.description: The value for accumulator A12, Service Hours, from the previous pay period. This is used in formulas that include the variable P12.

prevWcbPremHrs.description: The value for accumulator A13 from the previous pay period. This is used in formulas that include the variable P13.

prevMiscUnitsAccum1.description: The value for accumulator A14 from the previous pay period. This is used in formulas that include the variable P14.

prevMiscUnitsAccum2.description: The value for accumulator A15 from the previous pay period. This is used in formulas that include the variable P15.

prevMiscAccum16.description: The value for accumulator A16 from the previous pay period. This is used in formulas that include the variable P16.

prevMiscAccum19.description: The value for accumulator A19 from the previous pay period. This is used in formulas that include the variable P19.

prevMiscAccum20.description: The value for accumulator A20 from the previous pay period. This is used in formulas that include the variable P20.

prevMiscAccum21.description: The value for accumulator A21 from the previous pay period. This is used in formulas that include the variable P21.

prevMiscAccum22.description: The value for accumulator A22 from the previous pay period. This is used in formulas that include the variable P22.

prevMiscAccum23.description: The value for accumulator A23 from the previous pay period. This is used in formulas that include the variable P23.

prevMiscAccum24.description: The value for accumulator A24 from the previous pay period. This is used in formulas that include the variable P24.

prevMiscAccum28.description: The value for accumulator A28 from the previous pay period. This is used in formulas that include the variable P28.

prevMiscAccum30.description: The value for accumulator A30 from the previous pay period. This is used in formulas that include the variable P30.

empNo.description: The employee number of the employee. When not provided the employee number assigned to the current user will be used if available.

address1.description: The first line of the employee's home address.

address2.description: The second line of the employee's home address.

city.description: The city for the employee's home address.

province.description: The two character abbreviation of the province or state for the employee's home address. If the employee resides outside of Canada and the United States, province should be ZZ.

country.description: The three-character abbreviation of the country where the employee resides. If the province is a Canadian province or territory, the country should CAN. If the province is an American state, the country should be USA.

postal.description: The postal code of the employee's home address.

empNo.description: The employee number of the employee. When not provided the employee number assigned to the current user will be used if available.

initial.description: The middle initial of the employee's name.

preferredName.description: The name the employee prefers be called instead of their given name.

birthDate.description: The date of the employee's birth in ISO 8601 format. This is used to determine the employees Canadian Pension Plan (CPP) eligibility.

firstLanguage.description:
Indicates whether the employee would like their correspondence, such as pay statements, in French or English. 
F is French.
E is English.

gender.description:
Indicates whether the gender is female, male, or undefined. 
F is female.
M is male.
X is undefined.

sin.description: The employee's Social Insurance Number. If this is not available, nine zeros will be accepted. If the SIN starts with a 9, a sinExpiryDate should be specified.

sinExpiryDate.description: The date the employee's temporary Social Insurance Number (SIN) will expire. If the employee's SIN begins with a 9, this should be specified. The SIN expiry is in ISO 8601 format.

marital.description:
The marital status of the employee.
        M = Married
	S = Single
	D = CommonLaw
	E = Divorced
	F = Separated
	G = Widowed
	Any other character  = other

previousSurname.description: The employee's previous surname, if applicable.

empNo.description: The employee number of the employee. When not provided the employee number assigned to the current user will be used if available.

seniorityDate.description: The date used to determine the employee's seniority in ISO 8601 format.

empNo.description: The employee number of the employee. When not provided the employee number assigned to the current user will be used if available.

skip.description: The number of entries to skip.

take.description: The number of entries to take.

empNo.description: The employee number of the employee. When not provided the employee number assigned to the current user will be used if available.

preferredName.description: The name the employee prefers be called instead of their given name.

initial.description: The middle initial of the employee's name.

photoRevision.description: Used to prevent photo caching. When the photo is updated or the existing photo is deleted, enter a unique value here to ensure that the changes are applied immediately.

empNo.description: The employee number of the employee. When not provided the employee number assigned to the current user will be used if available.

title.description: This property is not used at this time.

contentType.description: The file type which will be one of the following valid options: jpeg, png, webp.

data.description: A byte array of the employee's photo.

contentLength.description: This property is not used at this time.

fileName.description: The filename and extension of the employee's photo.

table.description: The SQL table that contains the data that the report is being filtered on.

id.description: A unique numeric identifier for each filter. Must be set.

description.description: This is for internal use, and cannot be set.

letter.description: Determines the order of the filters, A is first and Z is last.

fieldName.description: The field that the filter is being set on.

condition.description:
How the value must relate to the field name. Enter the number for the condition. 
  Enter 0 for < 
  Enter 1 for =
  Enter 2 for >
  Enter 3 for <=
  Enter 4 for <>
  Enter 5 for  >=
  Enter 6 for 'Like'
  Enter 7 for 'Not Like'
  Enter 8 for 'In'
  Enter 9 for 'Not In'

value.description: The value that the data will be compared to in the filter. If valueType is 3, this should be a SQL expression.

valueType.description:
Enter number of the type of value being used in the filter. 
   0 = Field Value
   1 = Field Name
   2 = SQL Expression

conjunction.description:
Determines how this filter relates to the next filter in the same filter table. The order of the filters depends on the filter letter.  
   0 = And
   1 = Or

If you are filtering the results by multiple tables, the data must meet the filters for both tables to be included.

openingBrackets.description:
The number of brackets before this filter that define the relationship between multiple filters. 
For example: If you want the filter relationship (A or B) and (C or D), enter 1 for openingBrackets on filter A and C.

closingBrackets.description:
The number of brackets after this filter that define the relationship between multiple filters. 
For example: If you want the filter relationship (A or B) and (C or D), enter 1 for closingBrackets on filter B and D.

field.description:
Filter the codes returned by ID or description. This is required if you're filtering the returned codes. 

Code will filter by the ID. Description will filter by the code's description.

operator.description:
Will return codes that contain the value or does not contain the value. This is required if you're filtering the returned codes. 

Contains will return codes that have the value. Doesnotcontain will return codes that do not have the value.

value.description:
The value that the returned code must contain or not contain. 

This is required if you're filtering the returned codes.

skip.description: The number of entries to skip.
The number of entries to skip.

take.description: The number of entries to take.

read.description: Returns all the notifications read since the lastLoaded date. This is only returned if lastLoaded is included in the request parameters.

unread.description: Returns all the notifications marked as unread since the lastLoaded date. This is only returned if lastLoaded is included in the request parameters.

typeId.description: The identifier for the notification type.

parentId.description:
Will display the notification type id, if this notification type is a subcategory. 
If -1 is returned, this notification type is not a subcategory.

required.description:
If True, employees will be unable to change whether they will receive these notifications. If False, employees can choose whether they will receive these notifications. 
Whether employees can receive this notification type will be determined based on the selection for Enabled.

enabledDefault.description: If true, this type of notification is enabled for employees by default. If false, this type of notification is disabled for employees by default.

active.description: Indicates whether this type of notification is being used by the company. Returns True if the notification type is being used. Returns False if the notification type is not used in the company.

name.description: The English name for the notification type.

nameFr.description: The French name for the notification type.

description.description:
The English description for the notification type. 
This displays beneath the Type Name in Notification Settings when the employee logs into Avanti Go in English.

descriptionFr.description:
The French description for the notification type. 
This displays beneath the Type Name in Notification Settings when the employee logs into Avanti Go in French.

enabled.description: Indicates whether this type of notification is being used by the employee attached to the user.

username.description: The Avanti User Name that the employee uses to log into ASSP, Avanti Go, and the Avanti Desktop Application, if applicable. Must be a valid Avanti User Name.

empNo.description: The employee number of the employee. When not provided the employee number assigned to the current user will be used if available.

initial.description: The middle initial of the employee's name.

preferredName.description: The name the employee prefers be called instead of their given name.

city.description: The city for the employee's home address.

province.description: The two character abbreviation of the province or state for the employee's home address. If the employee resides outside of Canada and the United States, province should be ZZ.

country.description: The three-character abbreviation of the country where the employee resides. If the province is a Canadian province or territory, the country should CAN. If the province is an American state, the country should be USA.

sin.description: The employee's Social Insurance Number. If this is not available, nine zeros will be accepted. If the SIN starts with a 9, a sinExpiryDate should be specified.

sinExpiryDate.description: The date the employee's temporary Social Insurance Number (SIN) will expire. If the employee's SIN begins with a 9, this should be specified. The SIN expiry is in ISO 8601 format.

birthDate.description: The date of the employee's birth in ISO 8601 format. This is used to determine the employees Canadian Pension Plan (CPP) eligibility.

gender.description:
Indicates whether the gender is female, male, or undefined. 
F is female.
M is male.
X is undefined.

notificationId.description: The numeric identifier for the notification.

isRead.description: True if the notification is read. False if the notification is marked as unread.

username.description: The Avanti User Name that the employee uses to log into ASSP, Avanti Go, and the Avanti Desktop Application, if applicable. Must be a valid Avanti User Name.

actionId.description: Additional information about the notification, based on the notificationTypeId. If the notificationTypeId is 2, this returns the run number of the pay statement. If the notificationTypeId is 10001, this returns the schedule ID.

notificationTypeId.description:
The numeric identifier for the notification type.
Notification Type 1 is General. Notification Type 2 is pay statements. Notification Type 10001 is schedules.

subject.description: The subject line of the notification.

content.description: The full text of the notification.

excerpt.description: The first 128 characters of the content.

createdDate.description: The date the notification was created in ISO 8601 format.

modifiedDate.description: The date the notification was last marked as read or unread, in ISO 8601 format.

menuId.description: The Avanti menu that can be used with the ActionId to redirect users to the information in Avanti. For example, if the notification is for pay statements, the menuId is the pay statements menu. The ActionId  can be used to pull the pay statement from the notification.

enabled.description:
Indicates whether this type of notification is being used by the employee attached to the user. 
True if the employee is receiving this type of notification, False if the employee is blocking these notifications.

text.description: The number representing the Date field, from 1 to 12, in the order they appear on the Employee Profile. For example, M11 is 1.
The number of the Text Field, from 1 to 20, in the order they appear on the Employee Profile. For example, T1 is 1.

value.description: Text which can be up to 126 characters. If the Text Type in Payroll Parameters is anything other than Text or Required Text, the value match the ID of the selected Type.

height.description: This property is not used at this time.

paperName.description: This property is not used at this time.

rawKind.description: This property is not used at this time.

width.description: This property is not used at this time.

empNo.description: The employee number of the employee. When not provided the employee number assigned to the current user will be used if available.

runNumber.description: The run number of the payment.

payEndingDate.description: The last day of the pay period in ISO 8601 format.

keyExtension.description:
Indicates whether this is this the first pay in the pay period for the employee or a subsequent pay. 
KeyExtension will be 1 for the employee's first pay with this pay ending date, 2 for the second, etc.

chequeDate.description: The date the payment is deposited into the employee's bank or the date on the cheque in ISO 8601 format.

earnings.description: The total earnings for the payment, before deductions.

deductions.description: The total deductions for the payment.

benefits.description: The total benefits for the payment.

netPay.description: The net pay of the payment, which is the earnings minus the deductions.

desc.description: The description of the deduction code.

codeAndAbbrev.description: The code and abbreviation for the deduction code, separated by a space.

codeAndDesc.description: The code and description for the deduction code, separated by a space.

bankAccount.description: Returns the bank account. The bank account will be masked based on company web setting PayStatementSettings.BankAccountMask.

depositAmount.description: Returns the amount deposited into the bank account.

empNo.description: The employee number of the employee. When not provided the employee number assigned to the current user will be used if available.

otherText1.description:
Profile Field T1. Text which can be up to 126 characters. 
If the T1 Text Type in Payroll Parameters is anything other than Text or Required Text, the value match the ID of the selected Type.

chequeDate.description: The date the payment is deposited into the employee's bank or the date on the cheque in ISO 8601 format.

payEndingDate.description: The last day of the pay period in ISO 8601 format.

address1.description: The first line of the employee's home address.

address2.description: The second line of the employee's home address.

rate.description:
The dollar rate of pay for the time worked. This will be used with the units to determine the gross earnings for the time worked.

If blank, the rate of pay will be determined within Avanti.

The dollar rate of pay for the time worked. This will be used with the units to determine the gross earnings for the time worked.

If blank, the rate of pay will be determined within Avanti.

taskId.description:
The ID of the task for the time worked. 

For a list of tasks set up in the company, use the 'Get TaskIds' endpoint.

phoneType1.description:
The phone type of the phoneNumber1. 
        1 = Work
        2 = Home 
        3 = Work 2
        4 = Home 2
        5 = Work Fax
        6 = HomeFax
        7 = Cell
        8 = Pager
        9 = Other 
      10 = Work Cell
      11 = Home Cell

        1 = Work
        2 = Home

        8 = Pager
        9 = Other 
      10 = Work Cell
      11 = Home Cell

initial.description: The middle initial of the employee's name.

preferredName.description: The name the employee prefers be called instead of their given name.
The name the employee prefers be called instead of their given name.

title.description: This property is not used at this time.

username.description: The Avanti User Name that the employee uses to log into ASSP, Avanti Go, and the Avanti Desktop Application, if applicable. Must be a valid Avanti User Name.

rate.description:
The dollar rate of pay for the time worked. This will be used with the units to determine the gross earnings for the time worked.

If blank, the rate of pay will be determined within Avanti.

id.description: The report ID of the report you would like to get the data for.

format.description: This property is not used at this time.

allEmployees.description:
True will include all employees in the report. False will only include the employee range. If false, the employee range must be specified in fromEmpNo toEmpNo. 

Reports only include employees based on the active parameter, role permissions, and pay group access.

fromEmpNo.description: The first employee number in the range of employees employees used to filter the data. This is only used if allEmployees is false. This is required if toEmpNo is defined.

toEmpNo.description: The last employee in the range of employees used to filter the data. This is only used if allEmployees is false. This is required if fromEmpNo is defined.

active.description: True will include active employees in the results. False prevents active employees from being included in the results.

inactive.description: True will include inactive employees in the results. False prevents inactive employees from being included in the results.

allDates.description: True to include all dates in the report. False to include a date range. If false, the date range must be specified in fromDate toDate.

fromDate.description: The first date in the range of dates used to filter the data. This is only used if allDates is false. This is required if toDate is defined.

toDate.description: The last date in the range of dates used to filter the data. This is only used if allDates is false. This is required if fromDate is defined.

printThisReportOnly.description: This property is not used at this time.

overrideReportSelection.description: This property is not used at this time.

allPayGroups.description: True will include employees in the report regardless of pay group. False will only include the pay groups indicated in the selectedPayGroups parameter.

selectedPayGroups.description:
The pay groups of employees that will be included in the report. This will only be used if parameter allPayGroups is false.
Ex: selectedPayGroups: ["001", "002"] will only include employees in group 001 or 002 in the report.

allLocations.description: True will include all employees in the report regardless of their location. False will only include the employees in the locations indicated in the selectedLocations parameter.

selectedLocations.description:
The location codes of employees that will be included in the report. This will only be used if parameter allLocations is false.
Ex: selectedLocations: ["001", "002"] will only include employees in location 001 or 002 in the report.

isEmployeeReport.description: If true, only the results for the current employee will be returned.

title.description: This property is not used at this time.

footer.description: This property is not used at this time.

landscape.description: This property is not used at this time.

marginTop.description: This property is not used at this time.

marginRight.description: This property is not used at this time.

marginBottom.description: This property is not used at this time.

marginLeft.description: This property is not used at this time.

suppressBlankLines.description: This property is not used at this time.

suppressHeadings.description: This property is not used at this time.

merge.description: If true, the options set on the report definition will be used. If false, the options on the report definition will be ignored.

isValidated.description: This property is not used at this time.

id.description: The unique identifier for the menu.

field.description:
Display the codes in order by ID or description. By default, codes will display in order by ID. 

Code will return the codes in order by ID. Description will return the codes in order of the code's description.

dir.description:
Display the codes in order. By default, codes will display in ascending order. 

Asc will return the codes in ascending order, from smallest to largest or A to Z. Des will return the codes in descending order, from largest to smallest or Z to A.

text.description: The ID, Description or a combination of the two depending on the lookup setting.

empNo.description: The employee number of the employee. When not provided the employee number assigned to the current user will be used if available.

taskId.description:
The ID of the task for the time worked. 

For a list of tasks set up in the company, use the 'Get TaskIds' endpoint.

isProcessed.description:
Indicates whether the punch has been used to generate a Time Card. Default is false. If True is entered, this punch will not be used to generate punches in Avanti. 

This fields will not be returned when doing a get.

rate.description:
The dollar rate of pay for the time worked. This will be used with the units to determine the gross earnings for the time worked.

If blank, the rate of pay will be determined within Avanti.

payEndingDate.description: The last day of the pay period in ISO 8601 format.

empNo.description: The employee number of the employee. When not provided the employee number assigned to the current user will be used if available.

username.description: The Avanti User Name that the employee uses to log into ASSP, Avanti Go, and the Avanti Desktop Application, if applicable. Must be a valid Avanti User Name.

initial.description: The middle initial of the employee's name.

empNo.description: The employee number of the employee. When not provided the employee number assigned to the current user will be used if available.

isInPunch.description: Indicates whether the punch is a punch in or punch out. If true, it is an in punch. If false, it is an out punch. Default is false.

isBreak.description: Indicates whether the punch is for a break. If true, it is for a break. If false, it is not for a break. Default is false.

punchDateTime.description:
The time of the punch is the current time on the SQL Server, adjusted by the time zone specified on Web Punch Employee Setup on the Desktop Application. If there is no setup for the employee, the time will be adjusted by the Province of Employment on the Tax Factors tab of the Employee Profile.

This will be generated on a Post and should not be included in the body.

latitude.description:
Indicates the latitude of the employees location when they punched. This is required if company web setting MobileSettings.WebPunchSettings.RequireLocationServices is true. 

This will not be returned when doing a get.

longitude.description:
Indicates the longitude of the employee's location when they punched. This is required if company web setting MobileSettings.WebPunchSettings.RequireLocationServices is true. 

This will not be returned when doing a get.

title.description: This property is not used at this time.
